forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle. Partly cloudy, with a low around 59. South southwest wind around 2 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle before 10am. Sunny. High near 78, with temperatures falling to around 73 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco awakens with a gentle embrace of patchy drizzle, hinting at the remnants of a night filled with whispers of clouds. As the city comes to life, the air carries a refreshing coolness, a welcome respite for those venturing outside, with temperatures hovering around a serene 59 degrees. The early sun stretches across the skyline, promising a transformation; the day will warm to a comfortable 78, before gracefully settling back to 73 in the afternoon. Winds, soft and unhurried from the south southwest, weave through the streets, inviting a relaxed exploration of the city's enchanting corners.

While the forecast hints at sunny skies emerging post-mist, the lingering vestiges of fog linger close, draping the outer edges of the Golden Gate Bridge and teasing the hills. The marine layer will dance in and out throughout the morning, but by midday, clarity will grace the day, making the view from Twin Peaks or a stroll along the Embarcadero especially inviting. Consider dressing in layers—perhaps a light cardigan or a jacket to counter the morning cool and a comfortable tee to enjoy the warmth of the midday sun. As the city unfolds with life, why not explore the vibrant threads of the local farmers' market or find a cozy café to savor a quiet cup of coffee while watching the rhythm of the neighborhood? Nature and city bustle beckon hand-in-hand, creating a day worth savoring in this beloved coastal haven.
